data.title: Don Roberto R B Cunninghame Graham by Tschiffely a F
data.meta_description: Don Roberto: Being the Account of the Life and Works of R. B. Cunninghame Graham 1852 - 1936. by A. F. Tschiffely and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
First Edition. 8vo., bound in dark blue cloth gilt, wth gilt emblem to front cover, [xx], 458pp, indexed, illus throughout with b/w plates and drawings within text. Light foxing to edges and endpapers, slight handling wear and fading to boards. Good copy overall. No dust jacket. [200 BEE] PLEASE NOTE: Buyer is responsible for any additional duties, taxes, or fees required by recipient's country.** Pictures available upon request.** Visit our homepage for our shop opening hours. Over 20,000 books in stock - come and browse. PayPal, credit and most debit cards welcome. Books posted worldwide. For any queries please contact us direct.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good+. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good-. First Edition. In midnight blue/black boards with bright, unblemished gilt lettering to the spine, and a bright gilt 'motif' to the front board. In the original publisher's black/red lettered dustjacket which is complete, with a little closed chipping to the head of the spine, but is very sunned (the cream colour has 'tanned') to the spine and edges - but all titling/lettering, etc, is Very Clear. Overall a VG minus dustjacket which is now in a new protective clear - removable - bookfilm plastic cover and looks Very Good. The dustjacket is NOT price clipped. The page fore-edges are foxed (light brown spots) but Internally the text block is VERY clean and tight. (xx) + 458 pp. Frontispiece (A Bronze Bust of 'Don Roberto' by Jacob Epstein) , plus full page b/w plates, line-illustrations and Maps in the text, Bibliography, Index. "The classic biography of Robert Bontine Cunninghame Graham - born a Scottish aristocrat - but became a South American gaucho, a rancher in America's Wild West, and a political radical who was jailed for his beliefs. A writer and adventurer, he was the first MP to call himself a socialist and founded both the Scottish Labour Party and the SNP! . Written by Aimé Félix Tschiffely (May 7,1895-January 5,1954) a Swiss-born, Argentine professor, writer, and adventurer." ; Thick 8vo 8" - 9" tall.

Hard Cover. Condition: Near Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good Plus. First Edition. xx, 458pp, frontispiece, frontis and b/w plates, text-ills, bibliography, index. Prelims, endpages and paged edges foxed. Scattered foxing throughout. Prev owner's name by the upper edge of the front flyleaf with the AUTHOR's signature on the same page. Decorative cloth boards, gilt, in edge-worn dust jacket which has tears at the spine head and foot and wear at its corners. The biography of Tschiffeley's friend, the Scottish laird and one-time gaucho, horse-dealer, fencing master, explorer, Member of Parliament, wit, critic and writer. Size: 8vo. Signed.
